g.H5921: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
g.H102: (only plural) wings of an army, or crowds of troops
g.H7227: abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
g.H5971: a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
g.H834: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.

g.H1431: to be (causatively make) large (in various senses, as in body, mind, estate or honor, also in pride)
g.H6942: to be (causatively, make, pronounce or observe as) clean (ceremonially or morally)
g.H3045: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (includin...
g.H5869: an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
g.H7227: abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
g.H1471: a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
g.H3588: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
g.H3068: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
